metadata.name: AWS Route 53 Domain Transferred to Another Account
metadata.comment: Detects when a request has been made to transfer a Route 53 domain to another AWS account.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(metadata.product.name) = lower('route53.amazonaws.com') AND lower(metadata.event_code) = lower('transferdomaintoanotherawsaccount'))

output.summary: Detects when a request has been made to transfer a Route 53 domain to another AWS account.

metadata.objective: False positive: A domain may be transferred to another AWS account by a system or network administrator. Verify whether the user identity, user agent, and/or hostname should be making changes in your environment. Domain transfers from unfamiliar users or hosts should be investigated. If known behavior is causing false positives, it can be exempted from the rule. Reference: https://github.com/elastic/detection-rules/blob/c76a39796972ecde44cb1da6df47f1b6562c9770/rules/integrations/aws/persistence_route_53_domain_transferred_to_another_account.toml
